intro: Galium concinnum, commonly known as small whitlowgrass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium concinnum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
